intro: Aeschynomene pleuronervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural fields. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it beneficial for soil enrichment in certain ecological contexts.
